review.description: With the slew of Thai restaurants on Court Street, the quality of food is what will distinguish the good from the bad.  Unfortunately, the food here is just mediocre.  The service and the decor help, but it eventually boils down to the quality of the food.  I might stop by if the others are packed but if there is an open table elsewhere, that's where I'll be for my thai.
review.author: Sang H.

review.description: I was very surprised after reading all the negative feedback that this restaurant has recieved.  My boyfriend and I go there almost every week and we are never dissapointed.  The atmosphere is very nice, the food is delicous and the service is always very good.
review.author: Melanie T.

review.description: Very, very disappointing. Nice interior. However, the food was well below par. My drunken seafood noodles were a mess of overcooked angel-hair pasta with rubbery seafood in soap-dishy-tasting broth. The fried tofu appetizer was the consistency and flavor of cardboard. Save your cash and your stomach and try one of the other Thai places up and down the street.
review.author: Melissa C.
